ERC proposa un "gran consens" per l'amnistia que inclogui institucions, sindicats i patronals
No detalla encara com s'hauria de vehicular aquesta llei per aconseguir la llibertat dels presos

04 Nov 2019, 12:14

L'amnistia és un concepte que últimament ha entrat amb força en el discurs dels partits independentistes, i aquest dilluns ERC n'ha parlat en campanya electoral. Els republicans proposen que des de Catalunya es teixeixi un "gran consens" a favor de l'amnistia que inclogui no només les formacions polítiques que la defensen, sinó també el conjunt de les institucions catalanes i el teixit associatiu que, entre d'altres, integren universitats, sindicats i patronals.
Ho ha explicat en un acte de campanya l'exconseller de Justícia del Govern, Carles Mundó, precisament un dels condemnats per la sentència del Procés. Ho ha fet des de l'antiga presó Model de Barcelona, que ell va tancar mentre va ser membre de l'executiu. "L'amnistia és una fórmula jurídica que s'ha aplicat en uns altres moment excepcionals", ha argumentat. Mundó ha exposat que amnistiar els independentistes condemnats permetria treure el conflicte de la justícia i portar-lo al terreny exclusiu de la política que, segons ell, es l'únic on es podrà trobar una solució. 
L'amnistia s'ha de portar al Congrés en forma de llei. Hi ha dues vies: que el Parlament formuli una proposta i després l'enviï a la cambra baixa espanyola perquè es debati, o que siguin els mateixos partits independentistes els que la portin directament al Congrés. La primera via és més solemne, mentre que la segona seria més àgil. ERC no ha volgut entrar a detallar com s'hauria de fer. Mundó ha considerat que, si es detallés, aniria precisament en contra del "gran consens" que primer vol generar el seu partit. "No ens hem d'encasellar en una proposta o una altra", ha conclòs.
El principal obstacle de l'amnistia no és tant com s'ha de portar al Congrés, sinó que ara mateix no  hi ha una correlació de forces a l'hemicicle espanyol que permeti pensar que tindria alguna garantia d'èxit. PSOE, PP, Cs i Vox s'hi oposen frontalment i Podem és partidari d'explorar altres vies per aconseguir que els presos surtin de la presó. Malgrat això, Mundó s'ha mostrat optimista: "Que no sigui possible ara per la correlació de forces no vol dir que l'hàgim de deixar de presentar". 
Visita del rei
El candidat d'ERC a les generals, Gabriel Rufián, ha tornat a carregar contra la vista del rei avui a Barcelona. Ha dit que si vol fer "un acte electoral", que es presenti a les eleccions. "Si està tan preparat com diuen, potser les guanya", ha ironitzat. El republicà ha considerat que l'únic dubte que ofereix el monarca és "si és del PP, Vox, Cs o de tots tres alhora". També ha demanat que totes les mobilitzacions en contra de la presència de Felip VI siguin "cíviques i pacífiques". Representants d'ERC seran a les protestes.




El Govern fa una crida a mantenir una actitud cívica en les properes manifestacions

També ha parlat de l'escridassada que va rebre d'un grup de CDR aquest diumenge en un míting a Lleida. Ha assegurat que formava part "del càrrec" i que mai criticaria que la gent s'expressi. "Mai entraré a criminalitzar això", ha reblat.




El míting central d'ERC de la campanya del 10-N s'ha en una esplanada al costat de la presó de Lledoners. / MARC PUIG / ERC

Junqueras contra Sánchez
ERC ha concentrat tota l'artilleria d'aquesta campanya en carregar contra el PSOE i el PSC. Una nova mostra és la carta que el president dels republicans, Oriol Junqueras, ha enviat a Pedro Sánchez i que publica El Periódico. Al text, el líder d'ERC li recrimina haver-se negat al diàleg i li recorda que el vot de l'independentisme català va ser clau perquè prosperés la moció de censura que el va fer president del govern espanyol. El qualifica de "frívol" i "autoritari" i li retreu assemblar-se massa "a la dreta" que es va expulsar del poder amb la sortida de Rajoy de la Moncloa. 




ERC canvia el guió i enterra la mà estesa a Sánchez i al PSOE
text:
ERC proposes a "great consensus" for the amnesty that includes institutions, unions and employers'
It does not yet detail how this law should be used to secure the prisoners' freedom

04 Nov 2019, 12:14

Amnesty is a concept that has recently entered into the discourse of the independentist parties, and this Monday ERC has spoken in an election campaign. Republicans propose that from Catalonia, a "great consensus" be woven in favor of the amnesty that includes not only the political formations that defend it, but also the set of Catalan institutions and the associative fabric that, among others, They integrate universities, unions and employers' associations.
This has been explained in a campaign by the excuse of Justice of the Government, Carles Mundó, precisely one of the convicts for the ruling of the Process. He has done so since the old Model of Barcelona prison, which he closed while he was a member of the executive. "Amnesty is a legal formula that has been applied at other exceptional times," he argued. Mundó has stated that amnestining condemned independentists would allow the conflict of justice to be removed and brought to the exclusive domain of politics, which, according to him, is the only one where a solution can be found.
Amnesty must be taken to Congress in the form of a law. There are two ways: for Parliament to make a proposal and then send it to the lower house in Spain so that it is debated, or that it is the same independentist parties that take it directly to the Congress. The first route is more solemn, while the second one is more agile. ERC did not want to go into detail how it should be done. Mundó considered that, if detailed, it would go precisely against the "great consensus" that his party wants to generate first. "We do not have to fit into one proposal or another," he concluded.
The main obstacle to amnesty is not as much as it should be for Congress, but right now there is no correlation of forces in the Spanish Chamber that would allow us to think that it would have some guarantee of success. PSOE, PP, Cs and Vox are opposed frontally and We are in favor of exploring other ways to get prisoners out of jail. In spite of this, Mundó was optimistic: "That it is not possible now for the correlation of forces does not mean that we have to stop presenting it."
Visit of the king
The ERC candidate to the generals, Gabriel Rufián, has returned to charge against the king's sight today in Barcelona. He has said that if he wants to make "an election act", he will appear in the elections. "If you are so prepared as they say, maybe you win," he ironically. The Republican has considered that the only doubt offered by the monarch is "if it is from PP, Vox, Cs or all three at a time." He also called for all mobilizations against the presence of Philip VI to be "civic and peaceful." Representatives of ERC will be in protest.




The Government calls for a civic attitude in the next demonstrations

He also talked about the squad he received from a CDR group this Sunday at a meeting in Lleida. He assured that he was part of "the position" and that he would never criticize people to express themselves. "I will never go into criminalizing this," he remonstrated.




The central ERC meeting of the 10-N campaign was held on an esplanade next to the Lledoners prison. / MARC PUIG / ERC

Junqueras against Sanchez
ERC has concentrated all the artillery of this campaign when charging against the PSOE and the PSC. A new sample is the letter that the president of the republicans, Oriol Junqueras, sent to Pedro Sánchez and published by El Periódico. In the text, the leader of ERC recriminates refusing dialogue and reminded the Catalan independence vote was key to prosper the censure motion that made him president of the Spanish government. He describes it as "frivolous" and "authoritarian" and claims to be too "to the right" that was expelled from power with the departure of Rajoy de la Moncloa.




ERC changes the script and buries the hand out of Sánchez and the PSOE
